application.name: hifringe
application.brief: Gathers statistics on the first and last several samples of a channel
application.description:
Gathers several statistics on the "fringe" of a channel file. These statistics are then output to a pvl file that can be viewed to see if several channel files, based upon those statistics, are suitable for stitching together. The number of lines that are gathered is a function of the binning mode of the channel file being input as follows:
binning mode 1 48 rightmost and 48 leftmost samples gathered binning mode 2 24 rightmost and 24 leftmost samples gathered binning mode 3 16 rightmost and 16 leftmost samples gathered binning mode 4 12 rightmost and 12 leftmost samples gathered binning mode 8 6 rightmost and 6 leftmost samples gathered
The following statistics are gathered:
Valid Pixels Standard Deviation Average Minimum Maximum

history.change: Added the ability to sample multiple sections

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.brief: Single hirise channel in cub form
parameter.description: input channel file. Although this program is meant to be used solely for stitching channel files together, it could be used on any hirise image at all.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: This pvl file will contain two groups. The first group will be statistics for the leftmost samples, and the second group will be statistics for the rightmost samples.

parameter.name: SECTIONS
parameter.description: This is the number of sub-areas that are extracted from each side of the cube. They will be spaced in such a way that there will be a section starting at the l/nth line where l is the total number of lines in the cube and n is the number of sections specified.

parameter.name: LINESIZE
parameter.brief: Number of lines in each section
parameter.description: This is the number of lines in each section. If the user does not enter anything, or specifies an invalid number of lines (i.e. more lines than exist in the cube), the sections will be stretched to cover as many lines of the cube as possible

example.description: This example shows the statistics gathered from a single band of a cube.
